title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
fullTitle: Star Trek: The Next Generation (TV Series 1987â€“1994)

episodes.title: Evolution
episodes.plot: Wesley's latest science project escapes the lab, threatening the Enterprise and an eminent scientist's life-long project.

episodes.title: The Ensigns of Command
episodes.plot: After 111 years of silence, an extremely litigious alien race asserts its agreed upon right to wipe out a Federation colony in its territory.

episodes.title: The Survivors
episodes.plot: The Enterprise responds to a distress call from Rana IV, a Federation colony that is under attack from an unknown alien ship. When they arrive, they find the entire surface of the planet destroyed, save for a single house and two occupants.

episodes.title: Who Watches The Watchers
episodes.plot: A proto-Vulcan culture worships Captain Picard and prepares to offer Counselor Troi as a sacrifice.

episodes.title: The Bonding
episodes.plot: A startling surprise awaits the crew of the Enterprise when a mission costs the life of a crew member, who left her son behind.

episodes.title: Booby Trap
episodes.plot: The Enterprise triggers an ancient yet effective trap left by an extinct race, with a perfectly preserved derelict ship serving as cheese for Picard.

episodes.title: The Enemy
episodes.plot: La Forge gets left behind on a storm-plagued planet when the rest of his team encounters a Romulan warrior.

episodes.title: The Price
episodes.plot: While the Enterprise hosts negotiations for control of a stable wormhole, Troi forms a personal relationship with an opposing negotiator, unaware of his true being.

episodes.title: The Vengeance Factor
episodes.plot: The Enterprise pursues a race of "gatherers" who continue to raid Federation outposts, unaware of the dangers lurking among them.

episodes.title: The Defector
episodes.plot: When a Romulan officer defects to the Federation with a warning of a impending invasion, Capt. Picard struggles to decide if he is to be believed.

episodes.title: The Hunted
episodes.plot: Investigating a planet applying for membership into the Federation, the crew of the Enterprise finds a group of inhabitants who used to be soldiers, but now fight for their very existence.

episodes.title: The High Ground
episodes.plot: While visiting a planet under civil war, Dr. Crusher is taken hostage by an opposing faction of the planet's ruling government.

episodes.title: Deja Q
episodes.plot: Much to Picard's displeasure, Q reappears on the Enterprise, claiming to have been ejected from the Q Continuum, and therefore, lost his powers.

episodes.title: A Matter of Perspective
episodes.plot: The widow of respected scientist Dr. Nel Apgar accuses Riker of seducing her and killing her husband. Rather than turn Riker over for unfavorable trial, the Enterprise reconstructs the facts.

episodes.title: Yesterday's Enterprise
episodes.plot: The Enterprise C enters the Enterprise D's time and space continuum, where they find Picard and crew in a constant state of war with the Klingons, and only Guinan knows it.

episodes.title: The Offspring
episodes.plot: After returning from a cybernetics conference to the Enterprise, Data creates his own "child," much to the chagrin of his captain, and without regards to the ramifications with Starfleet.

episodes.title: Sins of The Father
episodes.plot: A Klingon commander comes aboard the Enterprise in an officer exchange program initiated by Starfleet, much to the chagrin of the crew.

episodes.title: Allegiance
episodes.plot: Picard is kidnapped and held with three different aliens and meanwhile replaced with a replica as impostor captain.

episodes.title: Captain's Holiday
episodes.plot: After mediating a difficult trade agreement, Captain Picard is encouraged to take a much needed rest on a vacationing planet, where he's visited by a strange race from the future, in search of a dangerous weapon.

episodes.title: Tin Man
episodes.plot: The Enterprise reaches out to an alien being, while dancing around with the Romulans, who want to attack it in an act of vengeance.

episodes.title: Hollow Pursuits
episodes.plot: A shy member of the "Enterprise" crew becomes addicted to the holodeck, where relationships are easier than in real life, when his knowledge is needed in engineering.

episodes.title: The Most Toys
episodes.plot: When transporting a dangerous material to the Enterprise, Data is kidnapped and the crew is led to believe he is dead when the shuttlecraft he was piloting explodes enroute.

episodes.title: Sarek
episodes.plot: Legendary Federation ambassador Sarek visits the Enterprise to conclude peace talks with a race called the Legarans. His arrival is accompanied with a rash of unusual emotional outbursts among the crew.

episodes.title: MÃ©nage Ã  Troi
episodes.plot: When Deanna's mother spurns advances made by a Ferengi Daimon, he takes it upon himself to kidnap the two of them, along with Commander Riker and steal them away aboard his ship.

episodes.title: Transfigurations
episodes.plot: The Enterprise finds a deserted planet where a ship has crashed, and, with it, the lone survivor with no memory, but extraordinary healing powers.

episodes.title: The Best of Both Worlds
episodes.plot: Responding to a distress call on one of the Federation's outer-most colonies, the Enterprise arrives...only to find a big hole in the ground where the town used to be, and discovers the Borg are behind the attack.
